intro: Euphorbia yayalesia, commonly known as the Yucatán spurge, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a structure called a cyathium. It is adapted to arid environments and stores water in its stems for survival. Euphorbia yayalesia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appearance.
